election_record.label: Massachusetts 1822 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: Beginning in 1822, the Original Election Returns for Governor and Lieutenant Governor for Massachusetts stopped listing individual results for the scattering votes, instead listing them simply as scattering. Any identification of scattering votes is because of results published in various newspapers.

sub_unit.name: Clarksburg
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Clarksburg.

sub_unit.name: Florida
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Florida.

sub_unit.name: Middleton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Middleton.

sub_unit.name: Monroe
sub_unit.note: Monroe was incorporated as a town in February of 1822 but no votes were recorded.

sub_unit.name: Palmer
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Palmer.

sub_unit.name: Greenwich
sub_unit.note: "Rejected, not being returned within time." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Wilmington
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Wilmington.

sub_unit.name: Rochester
sub_unit.note: "Signed by one Selectman only and Town Clerk." Original Election Returns.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston.
